SV_start.Description: Starting position of the SV in the chromosome

SV_end.Description: Ending position of the SV in the chromosome

SV_length.Description: Length of the SV (bp) (deletions have negative values)

Samples_ID.Description: List of the samples ID for which the SV was called (according to the SV input file)

REF.Description: Nucleotide sequence in the reference genome (extracted only from a VCF input file)

ALT.Description: Alternate nucleotide sequence (extracted only from a VCF input file)

FORMAT.Description: The FORMAT column from a VCF file

'SampleID'.Description: The sample ID column from a VCF file

Annotation_mode.Description: Indicate the type of annotation lines generated: annotation on the SV full length ('full'), annotation on each gene overlapped by the SV ('split')

Gene_count.Description: Number of overlapped genes with the SV

Overlapped_tx_length.Description: Length of the transcript (bp) overlapping with the SV

Overlapped_CDS_length.Description: Length of the CoDing Sequence (CDS) (bp) overlapped with the SV

Overlapped_CDS_percent.Description: Percent of the CoDing Sequence (CDS) (bp) overlapped with the SV

Frameshift.Description: Indicates if the CDS length is not divisible by three (yes or no)

Exon_count.Description: Number of exons of the transcript

Location.Description: SV location in the gene's. Values: txStart, txEnd, exon'i', intron'i' e.g. txStart-exon3

Location2.Description: SV location in the gene's coding regions. Values: UTR (no CDS in the gene), 5'UTR (before the CDS start), 3'UTR (after the CDS end), CDS (between the CDS start and the CDS end, can be in an exon or an intron). e.g. 3'UTR-CDS

Dist_nearest_SS.Description: Absolute distance to nearest splice site after considering exonic and intronic SV breakpoints

Intersect_start.Description: Start position of the intersection between the SV and a transcript

Intersect_end.Description: End position of the intersection between the SV and a transcript

RE_gene.Description: Name of the genes regulated by a regulatory element overlapped with the SV to annotate. When available, the regulated gene name is detailed with associated haploinsufficiency (HI), triplosensitivity (TS), Exomiser (EX) scores, OMIM and candidate genes. (For the filtering output, see the -REselect1 and -REselect2 options)

B_gain_source.Description: Origin of the benign gain genomic regions completely overlapping the SV to annotate: gnomAD, ClinVar (CLN), ClinGen (TS40), DGV (dgv, nsv or esv), DDD, 1000 genomes (1000g), Ira M. Hall’s lab (IMH), Children's Mercy Research Institute (CMRI)

B_gain_coord.Description: Coordinates of the benign gain genomic regions completely overlapping the SV to annotate

B_gain_AFmax.Description: Maximum allele frequency of the reported benign gain genomic regions (if available)

B_loss_source.Description: Origin of the benign loss genomic regions completely overlapping the SV to annotate: gnomAD, ClinVar (CLN), ClinGen (HI40), DGV (dgv, nsv or esv), DDD, 1000 genomes (1000g), Ira M. Hall’s lab (IMH), Children's Mercy Research Institute (CMRI)

B_loss_coord.Description: Coordinates of the benign loss genomic regions completely overlapping the SV to annotate

B_loss_AFmax.Description: Maximum allele frequency of the reported benign loss genomic regions (if available)

B_ins_source.Description: Origin of the benign insertion genomic regions completely overlapping the SV to annotate: gnomAD, ClinVar (CLN), 1000 genomes (1000g), Ira M. Hall's lab (IMH), Children's Mercy Research Institute (CMRI)

B_ins_coord.Description: Coordinates of the benign insertion genomic regions completely overlapping the SV to annotate

B_ins_AFmax.Description: Maximum allele frequency of the reported benign insertion genomic regions (if available)

B_inv_source.Description: Origin of the benign inversion genomic regions completely overlapping the SV to annotate: gnomAD, 1000 genomes (1000g), Ira M. Hall's lab (IMH), Children's Mercy Research Institute (CMRI)

B_inv_coord.Description: Coordinates of the benign inversion genomic regions completely overlapping the SV to annotate

B_inv_AFmax.Description: Maximum allele frequency of the reported benign inversion genomic regions (if available)

P_gain_phen.Description: Phenotype of the pathogenic gain genomic regions completely overlapped with the SV to annotate

P_gain_hpo.Description: HPO terms describing the pathogenic gain genomic regions completely overlapped with the SV to annotate

P_gain_source.Description: Origin of the pathogenic gain genomic regions completely overlapped with the SV to annotate: dbVarNR (dbVar), ClinVar (CLN), ClinGen (TS3)

P_gain_coord.Description: Coordinates of the pathogenic gain genomic regions completely overlapped with the SV to annotate

P_loss_phen.Description: Phenotype of the pathogenic loss genomic regions completely overlapped with the SV to annotate

P_loss_hpo.Description: HPO terms describing the pathogenic loss genomic regions completely overlapped with the SV to annotate

P_loss_source.Description: Origin of the pathogenic loss genomic regions completely overlapped with the SV to annotate: dbVarNR (dbVar), ClinVar (CLN), ClinGen (HI3), morbid

P_loss_coord.Description: Coordinates of the pathogenic loss genomic regions completely overlapped with the SV to annotate

P_ins_phen.Description: Phenotype of the pathogenic insertion genomic regions completely overlapped with the SV to annotate

P_ins_hpo.Description: HPO terms describing the pathogenic insertion genomic regions completely overlapped with the SV to annotate

P_ins_source.Description: Origin of the pathogenic insertion genomic regions completely overlapped with the SV to annotate: dbVarNR (dbVar), ClinVar (CLN)

P_ins_coord.Description: Coordinates of the pathogenic insertion genomic regions completely overlapped with the SV to annotate

P_snvindel_nb.Description: Number of pathogenic snv/indel from public databases completely overlapped with the SV to annotate

P_snvindel_phen.Description: Phenotypes of pathogenic snv/indel from public databases completely overlapped with the SV to annotate

TAD_coordinate.Description: Coordinates of the TAD whose boundaries overlapped with the annotated SV (boundaries included in the coordinates)

ENCODE_experiment.Description: ENCODE experiments used to define the TAD

GC_content_left.Description: GC content around the left SV breakpoint (+/- 100bp)

GC_content_right.Description: GC content around the right SV breakpoint (+/- 100bp)

Repeat_coord_left.Description: Repeats coordinates around the left SV breakpoint (+/- 100bp)

Repeat_type_left.Description: Repeats type around the left SV breakpoint (+/- 100bp) e.g. AluSp, L2b, L1PA2, LTR12C, SVA_D, ...

Repeat_coord_right.Description: Repeats coordinates around the right SV breakpoint (+/- 100bp)

Repeat_type_right.Description: Repeats type around the right SV breakpoint (+/- 100bp) e.g. AluSp, L2b, L1PA2, LTR12C, SVA_D, ...

Gap_left.Description: Gap regions coordinates around the left SV breakpoint (+/- 100bp)

Gap_right.Description: Gap regions coordinates around the right SV breakpoint (+/-100bp)

SegDup_left.Description: Segmental Duplication regions coordinates around the left SV breakpoint (+/- 100bp)

SegDup_right.Description: Segmental Duplication regions coordinates around the right SV breakpoint (+/- 100bp)

ENCODE_blacklist_left.Description: ENCODE blacklist regions coordinates around the left SV breakpoint (+/- 100bp)

ENCODE_blacklist_characteristics_left.Description: ENCODE blacklist regions characteristics around the left SV breakpoint (+/- 100bp)

ENCODE_blacklist_right.Description: ENCODE blacklist regions coordinates around the right SV breakpoint (+/- 100bp)

ENCODE_blacklist_characteristics_right.Description: ENCODE blacklist regions characteristics around the right SV breakpoint (+/- 100bp)

GenCC_disease.Description: GenCC disease name: e.g. Nizon-Isidor syndrome

GenCC_classification.Description: GenCC classification (Definitive, Strong, Moderate, Limited, Disputed, Animal Model Only, Refuted or No known disease relationship)

DDD_mode.Description: DDD allelic requirement: e.g. biallelic, hemizygous...

DDD_consequence.Description: DDD mutation consequence: e.g. 'loss of function', uncertain ...

ExAC_synZ.Description: Positive synZ_ExAC (Z score) from ExAC indicate gene intolerance to synonymous variation

ExAC_misZ.Description: Positive misZ_ExAC (Z score) from ExAC indicate gene intolerance to missense variation

ExAC_delZ.Description: Positive delZ_ExAC (Z score) from ExAC indicate gene intolerance to deletion

ExAC_dupZ.Description: Positive dupZ_ExAC (Z score) from ExAC indicate gene intolerance to duplication

ExAC_cnvZ.Description: Positive cnvZ_ExAC (Z score) from ExAC indicate gene intolerance to CNV

OMIM_inheritance.Description: e.g. AD (= 'Autosomal dominant'). Detailed in AnnotSV's FAQ.

OMIM_morbid.Description: Set to 'yes' if the SV overlaps an OMIM morbid gene

OMIM_morbid_candidate.Description: Set to 'yes' if the SV overlaps an OMIM morbid gene candidate

LOEUF_bin.Description: Minimal 'decile bin of LOEUF' for given transcripts of a gene (lower values indicate more constrained). Values = integer [0-9]

GnomAD_pLI.Description: Score computed by gnomAD indicating the probability that a gene is intolerant to a loss of function variation (Nonsense, splice acceptor/donor variants due to SNV/indel)

ExAC_pLI.Description: Score computed by ExAC indicating the probability that a gene is intolerant to a loss of function variation (Nonsense, splice acceptor/donor variants due to SNV/indel). ExAC considers pLI>=0.9 as an extremely LoF intolerant gene

Exomiser_gene_pheno_score.Description: Exomiser score for how close each overlapped gene is to the phenotype

Compound_htz(sample).Description: List of heterozygous SNV/indel (reported with 'chrom_position') presents in the gene overlapped by the annotated SV

Count_hom(sample).Description: Number of homozygous SNV/indel (extracted from VCF input file) in the individual 'sample' which are present: 1) in the deletion SV ('full' annotation) and 2) between intersectStart and intersectEnd ('split' annotation)

Count_htz(sample).Description: Number of heterozygous SNV/indel (extracted from VCF input file) in the individual 'sample' which are present: 1) in the SV ('full' annotation) and 2) between intersectStart and intersectEnd ('split' annotation)

Count_total(cohort).Description: Total count of SNV/indel called from all the samples of the cohort and present in the interval of the deletion

AnnotSV_ranking_score.Description: SV ranking score following the 2019 joint consensus recommendation of ACMG and ClinGen. Scoring: pathogenic >= 0.99, likely pathogenic [0.90;0.98], variant of uncertain significance [0.89;-0.89], likely benign [-0.90;-0.98], benign <= -0.99.

AnnotSV_ranking_criteria.Description: Decision criteria explaining the AnnotSV ranking score

ACMG_class.Description: SV ranking class into 1 of 5: class 1 (benign), class 2 (likely benign), class 3 (variant of unknown significance), class 4 (likely pathogenic), class 5 (pathogenic)

RE.Description: Reads Expected: the number of expected reads under the probabilistic model (Decon)

RO.Description: Reads observed: the number of observed reads (Decon)

RR.Description: Reads ratio: the ratio of observed to expected reads (Decon)

NC.Description: N.comp: the number of samples used as the reference set (Decon)

CO.Description: Correlation: the maximum correlation between the test sample and any other sample in the full set of BAM files (Decon)

BF.Description: Bayes factor associated with the call (Decon)
